item.description:
I will be playing violin with the Lowell House Opera's production of Britten's "A Midsummer Night's Dream." The libretto uses the original Shakespeare dialogue and it's very funny. The opera is about the adventures of four young lovers in a love quadrangle and a group of six amateur actors who are controlled and manipulated by the King and Queen of fairies who inhabit the forest. At one point, the fairy King punishes the fairy Queen by making her fall in love with a donkey. Here are the performance dates:

Friday, March 29 @ 8:30 p.m.
Saturday, March 30 @ 8:30 p.m.
Wednesday, April 3 @ 8:30 p.m.
Friday, April 5 @ 8:30 p.m.
Saturday, April 6 @ 8:30 p.m.

All shows take place at the Lowell House dining hall at Harvard University which is 10 Holyoke Place, Cambridge. There is only one entrance which is at the main gate; when you enter through the main gate, the dining hall is directly in front of you.

Tix are $12-$20 and can be purchased at the Harvard Box Office or online. http://lowellhouseopera.com/tickets/

I can meet with people during intermission as well as afterwards.
